1.Text:
On a day after the Shadow Garden returned　from
investigating the Sanctuary...

The materials the team brought back with them are
delivered to Eta, who begins her analytical
investigation.

—Investigative report No. 004, the Tears of Diablos.
A red liquid created from the cells of Diablos...

—Those who ingest this liquid gain vast power and an
eternally youthful body...

—Though the Tears have no side effects, periodical
inoculation is required, and they can only be
produced in limited quantities...

—*sigh* A collection of answers...that I already
know... I was aware this would be the case, but it's
still...disappointing...

And this data... Is it recent? Is this all they can
deduce...even with modern technology?

If the Tears are imperfect...then why do they
continue to use them?
*sigh* Incomprehensible...

I would never permit that... It's a desecration of
science...

Urgh... When I get like this...the only cure is the
nutritional supplement "Calorie Made"!
*chomp*...*munch, munch*...
—Whoa, looks like someone's in a mood.

Eta turns at the sound of the voice behind her to
see Zeta standing in the doorway of the lab.
...*munch* Zeta? What...do you want?

Ugh, at least swallow your food before you talk...
I brought some more documents by, but am I
interrupting something?
...*gulp* Not really...

The door was wide open so I just let myself in.
Anyway, here you go.
...Just set them...over there.
So, on top of this pile of papers?
Sure...

Gotta say, it's a rare thing to see you showing any
sort of emotion. Is the report getting to you?
Zeta points at the materials in Eta's hand.
Well...you could say that...

There...wasn't much new information... More like
a compilation of our previous findings.

But...shouldn't we also be happy that it proves our
intel work was on-point?

That's how the organization would see it...
But I couldn't care less...

I'm a scientist... For me...ignorance is shame...
I exist to make the impossible, possible...
...You're really fired up today, huh?

I...always am... But the problem is...this report on
the Tears of Diablos...
This...should be a simple task for me, and yet...

Hmm... I'm guessing that you're irked because it has
imperfections?
Well... Yes...

The mere mention of the topic causes Eta's face to
take on an extremely irritated expression.

...Gotcha. I think I have a good idea of what makes
you tick now.

So what is it you want to do? Create a perfected
version of the Tears of Diablos?

I don't know... But formulating an elixir for eternal
youth...doesn't sound so bad...

But you don't get to make the call on your own when
it comes to stuff of that level. Not to mention that
you'd also need royal blood and Diablos cells.
Urgh... Maybe if I asked Gamma...
They don't sell that stuff at Mitsugoshi, you know.
Grrr... But maybe with enough money...

...Money isn't going to solve this. Besides, your
research is meant to serve the Garden, and Gamma
already funds it with her earnings anyway.
...Tch.
Um, did you just click your tongue at me?
Just your imagination...

Look at it this way—it's possible the Cult had their
own set of troubles. Like with resources or
interpersonal relationships.

I mean, the Knights of Rounds has 12 members.
Making a miracle youth pill that satisfies the
greed of that many puffed-up toads at once
is a pipe dream.

Zeta... Are there any bases...we haven't
investigated?

Bases we haven't investigated? Well, there are
several locations I uncovered while on infiltration
ops. I haven't reported some of them.
Haven't reported? You're...concealing information?
Hey now, let's not describe it like that.

I'm not concealing anything—I just convey my intel on
a need-to-know basis. Which is all the better since
dubious info could sow chaos in the Garden.
If you have any leads...tell me.
Why?

Imperfection...is unacceptable... And the debased
scientists at fault...must be punished...

Eta... I can't say I've ever seen you this interested
in the Cult.

I'm trying to think if I found anything that'd tickle
your fancy... Hmm...

Eta's expression remains uncharacteristically serious
as Zeta tries to recall some relevant information.

Now that you mention it, there was a place that
seemed like an old research facility in a city kinda
far from here.
A research facility? One of the Cult's?

Possibly. I poked around inside a bit, and there's no
doubt it was being used for some kind of research.
But I didn't see any signs of recent activity, so they
must've abandoned it for some reason.
And this..."city kinda far from here"...is?
...The college town, Laugus.

The college town...Laugus... The Cult's reach extends
that far?

This is just a hunch, but after what we saw at the
Sanctuary, I think it's safe to say that almost
nowhere is free from the Cult's influence.

If a place seems suspicious, then we'd do well to
treat it as such.

Besides, it'd be even more strange to not suspect
anything with it being so close to the
stomping ground of so many smart people.

...Oh, but not to say they're anywhere near as smart
as you, Eta.

Zeta quickly tacks this last part on, sensing that
calling the Cult "smart" might upset Eta, given her
current mood.
...Naturally.

Anyways, I'll prioritize investigating the facility
in Laugus. I'll put in a request with Lady Alpha,
so I'm sure in good time she'll put together a
team to—
—I'm going myself this time!
...Huh?
Eta suddenly ensnares Zeta with a tendril of slime.
H-Hey?! Eta?!

I can't...wait... You're the only one...who knows
the location...so you'll show me...the way...

O-Okay, okay! Just let me go! It's a bit of a trip,
so we'll need to make some basic preparations!
Got it?! I won't try to run!

Zeta eventually manages to get Eta to put her down
and then makes ready for their distant investigation.
The two then set off for the supposed research
facility in Laugus.

2.Text:
After several days of travel, Zeta and Eta arrive at
the edge of the archipelago where Laugus is located.
Are we...there yet?
Almost, so be patient.

The two continue along the shoreline for a bit
longer, eventually reaching the entrance to the
facility.
...This is the place.
Are these...traces of an explosion?

It was like this when I was here before. Beats me as
to why, though. One possibility is that it happened
when they ditched the place.

I doubt anything has changed since last time, but I
guess we may as well take a look inside.
You can lead the way...
Yeah, yeah...
It's dark in here, so watch your step.
I'm using magic as a light source...so I'm fine...

The corridor isn't that long, so we'll be there in
a flash.

The exterior walls...have collapsed... Probably...
due to the explosion...

There are documents and stuff that got blown
everywhere in the blast too. They're all too scorched
to read, though.
This was definitely...a research facility...

We're still in the passageway here. The exit is just
up ahead.

Zeta and Eta proceed down the dark corridor,
observing their surroundings along the way. Before
long they come upon—
*gasp* A giant...door?
...You surprised?
I want...a closer look...
A strange door... Doesn't look like it will open...

I didn't know this when I first came here, but a few
things clicked after seeing the Sanctuary report.
This crest means we can assume this place has some
connection to the Sanctuary.

Anyway, don't you think it's odd how this huge door
is completely unscathed while everything around it is
blown to smithereens?

Good point... Powerful protective magic... Perhaps...
it was that important?
Let's check the area a little more.
Zeta... Over here... There's an apparatus...

Well I'll be. Is it an artifact? It seems like it's
meant to react to something.

It needs something...to unlock it... I think...this
device opens the door...

We're still locked out, but I guess you could call
that progress.

We've checked everything there is to check here, so I
suppose that leaves looking under the rubble.

Zeta and Eta inspect the area for a while longer,
until...
...Hey, are you even listening?
The floor...is odd.
...The floor?
It sinks down...if I step on it...
That is suspicious... It could be trap, so be caref—
—There!
H-Hey, don't do anything rash!

Magic amasses before Eta and Zeta's eyes, taking on
shape of a door.
Whoa, something appeared!

Is this...a secret door? Maybe there's a clue on how
to open the big door behind this one?
Probably... Let's go inside...
Zeta?

Judging by this intricate setup, I'd say there's
definitely something here.

And then there's the feel of this place... Its
similar to the setup found in the Sanctuary report...

...I want to make a few little preparations before we
go in there.
...Preparations?
A while later...

Upon passing through the hidden door, Eta and Zeta
behold a familiar sight...
Is this...the Sanctuary?

No, not likely. The Sanctuary that Lady Alpha and the
others explored should no longer exist, so this has
to be somewhere entirely different.

But the interior does look almost identical, so maybe
we could say it's another Sanctuary based off the
original.
I see...

That reminds me...why did you change your outfit
before coming in here?

I surmised that this was another Sanctuary from the
way the entrance looked.

According to Epsilon's report, the Sanctuary was
designed to drain magic in greater amounts the closer
one got to its center.

That section really stuck out to me since it had so
much emphasis, like she'd scribbled it in a rage.
That's..Epsilon for you...

Yeah. She probably thought it was crucial info for us
to know because of how much we rely on magic.
She's really smart that way.

Zeta and Eta try amassing their magic, only to find
that their control over it is unstable.

...Seems we can only maintain the shape of any slime
constructs for around a minute at most. Good thing I
brought along a set of travel clothes.

We'll have an easier time dealing with anything that
comes our way if we aren't distracted by our slime
suits.
I don't mind being naked...
Well you should...
Anyway...does this look like Midgar to you?
Now that you mention it...

It looks a little older than the city we know, but I
see a few spots I recognize here and there.
So...where should we investigate...and how?

...Well, I guess that place over there looks kind of
suspicious.

Zeta points out a particular store, but Eta fails
to understand her reasoning.
Looks like an ordinary shop...to me...

Well, it isn't built in the architectural style of
Midgar, and it's a different business in the present.
But...I suppose that last one doesn't really count
since things do change over time.

I have faith in my powers of observation, see.
I'm good at picking up on things that are out of place
in new territory.
And you do this a lot?
Of course. It's like a habit now.
Huh...
Then I'll leave this part to you...
Right, so let's get moving.

They approach the shop Zeta indicated, but the
moment they touch the door—
We've been teleported again... Is this...a warehouse?
...Now I get it.
Hm?

This Sanctuary is designed so that only someone
intelligent can proceed. It's like a maze, a battle
of wits.

Any boneheads who rely on brawn would be stuck
wandering in here forever. A real dog's death for a
certain someone we know.
But for us intellectuals...all too easy...

Yep, we're the perfect team for this. Anyway, let's
see if there are any suspicious documents worth—
Grrr...

Ack, a monster? Maybe it's this place's guard dog?
You gonna get in our way, Fido?

This could get a little tricky without magic. So Eta,
I'm gonna need you to watch my ba—
...Uh, Eta? Where're you going?
Can't reach...those documents... Grr... Urgh...

Seriously?! Shouldn't we get rid of the monster
first?!
...You can handle the combat...on your own... Later.
Uh...

While the monster is focused on Zeta, Eta slips off
into the depths of the warehouse.

Oh for the love of... Guess I have a fight on my
hands!

Sensing the monster pouncing from in front of her,
Zeta throws herself into the battle.

3.Text:
Several monsters in the warehouse move to
attack Zeta.
Grrarrr!
Hah!

Without my slime bodysuit, even a normal attack could
prove fatal. Gotta make sure I don't get hit—

I don't like my odds, being stuck on the defensive
like this. Time to use the terrain to my advantage!
Zeta baits the monsters along as she flees.

If I can keep things so it's always one-on-one,
I should have a fighting chance even against this
mob!
Now! Haaaah!

Manipulating what constitutes a minute amount of
magic even in this unstable space, Zeta instantly
crafts a small knife out of slime and strikes
unerringly at the monster's vitals.
Grrarrrgh...
Alright! On to the next one!
Gwaarrr...

Alright, that should take care of the creeps chasing
me. Wait...looks like one is missing.
Help...
Eta?! I'm on my way!!!
...Eta! Are you okay?!
Take that! And that!
Grrar! Grrrarr!

Eta has taken refuge in an elevated position and is
swinging a book around frantically.
Without any slime, Eta is...pretty helpless...

It...came after me because it thinks I'm weak...
What a jerk...
Oh, Zeta. Hurry up and help me.
...After you just left me hanging high and dry?

It's called putting the right person in the right
place! Besides, while you kept them busy...I
collected...some choice data!
Cooperation...makes the world go round!
Not the most persuasive argument, but whatever...

With the monster focused on Eta, Zeta is able to
slip close unnoticed and defeat it easily.
Gwaarrr...
I'm safe... Thanks...
You're welcome. So, you get want you wanted?
Yeah... Here we are...
Dozens of folders tumble out of Eta's lab coat.

Whoa, you found all this in such a short time?!
I'm impressed, Eta.

It was all in one place... Scientists like to stay
put...once they get in the zone... So everything
important...tends to accumulate around them...
That just sounds sloppy to me.
I prefer to call it "efficient"...
Yeah, Yeah. Efficient. Very efficient.

I'm sure there are some proper scientists out there,
but being around you has kinda skewed my view of
them.
Anyway... Take a look at this...
Hm, let's see...
Zeta takes the folder and flips through it.

...This is about the Tears of Diablos? Huh, you
actually found something.

The date on this data...is from a thousand years
ago... And it contains...an overview of the Tears...
Wait, so you mean...

Yeah... The overall concept of the Tears of Diablos
was nearly completed back then.

But what Jack Nelson produced adhered to this design
without change... They're even more incompetent...
than I imagined...

Still, there must've been someone who came up with
the method of manufacturing the Tears, right? Maybe
these files contain something about them.

Zeta and Eta divide up the files and begin to read
through them.
...I don't see anything in here. How about you?

"The College City Plan"... This file...might have
something...
Really? What's it say?

...Laugus was originally the second laboratory of a
certain esteemed scientist. It seems that it then
grew into a city...

This scientist was inquisitive to the point of
insanity... Though a so-called "mad scientist", his
abilities were undeniable. Thus other brilliant minds
began to gather around him.

And then technology advanced, and a city began to
take shape...Laugus, the college town...
And what's the name of this esteemed scientist?

—Lord Laugus. Apparently he was the first chancellor
of the college town...

Gotcha... That certainly gives us more leads. Let's
keep digging and see what else we can find.

The two of them begin to haphazardly search for more
information on Laugus.
...So to sum up what we know...

Lord Laugus was a mad scientist who was also known
for his brilliance. He was also the first chancellor
of the college town that shares his name.

Being the type of person who'd do anything to satisfy
his own curiosity, Laugus also took the initiative in
researching the Tears.

Laugus would do anything to satisfy his curiosity.
The Cult took a liking to him, and he in turn became
fascinated with their study of immortality, which
caused him to stray down a dark path.

He eventually became the eleventh member of the
Knights of Rounds, occupying the seat of "Avarice"
later held by Jack Nelson. That shows just how much
the Cult favored him.

And this second Sanctuary here was Laugus's secret
hideout, an other-dimensional villa to house all the
things his little laboratory no longer could.

On the surface, Laugus was a scientific genius and
a chancellor. But he was also secretly a lunatic who
lent his talents to the Cult's research.

Still...it's a mystery as to why he never
perfected the Tears of Diablos... If he really was
as skilled as they say...he should have done so much
sooner...

No more records exist...after a certain point... It's
possible that something...happened to Laugus...

But that's all we can tell from the documents found
here... It's nothing but conjecture...

The key to the big door...remains an unknown as
well...

True. We've combed this area over pretty thoroughly,
so let's go try somewhere else.
Agreed...

Zeta and Eta depart in search of information on
Laugus and the key to the big door...

4.Text:
The duo teleport time and again in their hunt for
fresh data. Eventually they arrive in a dark cavern—
There's only one path... Is it a dead end?

Nope. I can feel a breeze coming through the gaps in
that wall.
Well, Zeta?

—Yep, just as I thought. It's gonna be tight, but we
can squeeze through. Watch your head.
Okay...
Oww...
What did I just say...

Zeta and Eta hunch down and make their way through
the gap in the wall, eventually coming upon a
slightly more open space where the cavern splits into
two paths.
Two ways forward... Which is the right one?

I don't know, but it looks like we have some wall art
now. Let's take a look...
A red cat...
...and a blue...dog?

Both of them have the same text carved beneath...
"Seek ye the path of the powerful."
A hint?

Most likely. So we're being asked which is more
powerful, the red cat or the blue dog, huh?
An odd question...
But the answer is easy.
Easy?

It's the cat, of course! N-Now c'mon, let's take the
cat's path!

Uh...are you sure? Shouldn't we think this over a
bit more?

Didn't you say that...this place is designed so that
only the intelligent may proceed?

Don't worry about all that! Everyone in the world
knows that a cat is always better than some lousy
dog!
Isn't that just...your own bias?

No, I'm serious! According to my investigations, one
in two people prefer cats to dogs, and there are
treatises stating that the cat will always win in a
head-to-head fight.
*stare*...

A-Anyway, it's totally not possible, but on the off
chance...on the million-to-one off chance that I'm
wrong, all we need to do is turn around, right?
*stare*...

Fine! I'll be honest! I will never accept a dog being
the right answer over a cat, no matter the question!
It can only be spite on the part of the author! Now
let's go!

I did come up with my own answer...but if you feel
that strongly about it...I can humor you...

Eta gives in to Zeta's forceful entreaty, and the two
embark upon the left path.
We've come quite a long way...but there's nothing...

My body tells me we've been walking for five minutes
or so, but yeah, nothing. The path continues onward,
so it may be further ahea—
*gasp*
Oh.

With a rumble, the ground below them collapses. Zeta
quickly leaps to safety, but Eta is slow to react...
Uh-oh...
Eta tumbles into the pitfall that opens beneath her.
Eta?! Damn, a trap!!!
It...It's all because I chose this path! Eta?!
Eta! Eta! Say something if you can hear me—
Eta's voice can be heard faintly from the pit.
I can hear you...
Eta?! Y-You're alright?!
I'm...hanging on...
Wha... Hanging on?

Eta has managed to stop her fall partway down the pit
by creating a wrench out of slime and plunging it
into the wall.
*sway*...

Hurry up and save me... My arms...are on fire... And
the slime...isn't stable...

She made a slime wrench and stuck it in the wall,
huh... Whew...

...Wait, this is no time to be relieved! I'll be
right there!
Whew... Thought I was a goner...

Sorry. I lost my cool back there... But after that
spine-chilling experience, I've got it back.

It's okay... I understand it was...a delicate
matter...

With Eta now safe, she and Zeta return to the
chamber with the pictures.

You said you came up with your own answer, so let's
hear it.

What's drawn and written here...has no bearing on the
question.
What matters are...the colors and conjecture.
The colors?

First...our circumstances. The cave is dark, so it's
hard to identify which color is which.
I see...

This next part is conjecture, but red is often used
as a warning, while green or blue are used to
represent safety...

Master Shadow also mentioned something about red
meaning "stop" and blue meaning "go."
Hmm...

And thus we have my answer...although it's just a
theory.

But I am a scientist. I draw my conclusions based
on cues from the environment, experience,
knowledge, and all possibilities.

And if I'm proven wrong, all the better. I'll simply
use that lesson the next time I encounter a similar
situation.
Eta...
...Why are you looking at me like that?

...I'm just realizing how little I know about you.
We almost never go on missions together, so getting
to see a little bit of who you are feels new to me.

You're much more logical than I had thought. You can
also be crazy at times...but I suppose that's also
part of the package with your rational mindset.
Hm? Was that an insult?
Haha, you're imagining things.

I'm gonna go with your theory about this riddle.
I mean, it's probably fine anyway since the other
path already proved to be no good.
Okay, the path of the dog it is...

...Another fork in the road. There's more wall art
here too, so I take it we made the right choice?
What is it this time?

The picture depicts a single minecart and a set of
tracks with a fork branching off. Proceeding along
the tracks leads to five people, while at the end
of the fork there is one person...
This is a...minecart puzzle?

If the cart keeps going straight there will be five
casualties. But if it switches tracks, only one
person dies. So it's a question of choosing
whether to sacrifice the life of one for the many.

Doesn't seem like the answer will come easy, but what
do you think, Eta?

I knew my answer the moment I saw it...but I'd like
to hear your thoughts too...

My thoughts? Okay... Since the inevitable
outcome is five deaths, and one person makes it out
alive if the cart continues going straight...

I suppose I wouldn't do anything and just let fate
run its course. I tried using my intuition this time.
...How'd I do?

Not bad. Everyone has their own way of seeing things,
so I won't reject yours...
And what's your answer?

Mine...takes into account the "quality," not
"quantity" of people. For example, if I were in that
cart, I believe the right choice would be the path
where I survive.

I think of my knowledge and talents as assets to the
world. So it's...natural...that others of little
worth...might lose their lives in place of mine.
Quality, eh...

I'm also considering the nature of the person who
created this riddle...since Laugus and I...share a
few things in common...

Hmm... Guess that's how you big-brain scientists see
the world, huh.

In short...all lives are not equal. Great knowledge
and ability are of value to the world. So—
Eta's expression grows unusually serious.

If, supposing...my life were weighed against that of
Master Shadow...I believe I would be obligated to
forfeit my existence without hesitation.
Uh...
Do you...dislike this line of thinking?
...Heheh.

...No, I don't. What you said now just made me
realize that I'd make the same choice if such a time
ever came.

You know what...I think I like you. I want to make
you one of my underlings. What do you say?
...Sounds annoying.

Haha, aw, you're no fun. But enough about that—
Let's choose a path...
Agh?!
What's this light—
A sudden burst of light swallows the pair up—

5.Text:
Once in the grip of the dazzlingly strong light, Zeta
and Eta are warped to a certain library—

Is this room...an archive? It feels a little
different than the last one.
Perhaps our intent...was the key to the teleport...

...Interesting. So the requirement to make the move
was just thinking like Laugus. A mindset befitting
one of great ability.
So goes my theory...
Now, time for the files...

Eta is drawn toward the mountain of files, perhaps
having realized at a glance how much valuable research
they contain.

*sigh* Never change, Eta... I would say, "Watch out
for monsters," but I don't think she's listening.
Okay, let the investigation begin.
Zeta reaches out for a nearby file as well.
This archive...is very specific.

This isn't reference data used in the investigative
process—it's all conclusions Laugus drew, details
based on truths he arrived at...

I'd love to take all of this back to base...but I
think getting it out of this space won't be easy.
When we teleport, it probably won't—
...Zeta.

Ack?! You startled me! Don't talk to me from behind
like that!
The files here...are kind of strange...
Strange?
Everything here...was carefully selected...
Yeah, I noticed that too.

The ratio of data on topics like the Tears of Diablos
and royal blood...has also decreased...

So maybe Laugus lost interest? Could that have
something to do with his disappearance?

Further in was data on things like the origins of
magic and the genesis of monsters, almost like his
curiosity shifted elsewhere...
What the hell happened...
Oh...and I found this...
Eta produces a well-worn book.
...Is this a journal? Did you check what's inside?
No...I held back... It might be a trap...

Wow, good for you. That's way different than when we
first got here.

I'm not some dunce...who can't learn from her
mistakes...
Zeta... You read it...
Is that what you were really after? Well, not like I mind...
Zeta opens the journal cautiously.
Okay, let’s see...

—O ye of keen mind. That ye are seeing this journal
means that ye are a personage of acumen and
excellence.
So he wrote this...assuming someone would see it?
That is weird, huh... I'll keep going.

—Upon beholding the contents of this chamber, ye may
surmise that the Tears of Diablos no longer hold any
interest for me.

—To be precise...I have decided that I must give
priority to a being greater than the Tears, to
research of a more primordial variety. My concerns
lay...with things far more grand.

—Ye of keen mind. I have faith that one such as ye
will perceive "something" upon beholding what lies
beyond the large door.
—The key to unlock it is—

—"I am a seeker of truth. A pursuer of boundless
knowledge."
This is...the key...
I've got a bad feeling about this...

Something of greater interest than the Tears of
Diablos? What could he mean?

Is there anything that stands out...in the pages of
the journal?
Oh, right. Let's see...

—As it happens, the Cult has been issuing more
orders as of late. It would seem they are displeased
that I have ceased my research on the Tears.

—If I were to continue, I could readily create Tears
of a higher quality. However, I have already
perfected the basic theory. There is nothing so dull
as research where the outcome is already in sight.

—The power of eternal youth has undeniable appeal.
And yet, continuing an inquiry to which I know the
answer lacks any sort of meaning to a scientist
such as I.

—The remaining scientists are more than capable of
handling the rest. Still...I have no doubt the one in
charge will lose a few more hairs due to the stress.
Hahahaha!

And there you have it. I guess most scientists are
kind of weird, huh?

His successor was...Jack Nelson, right? I heard that
he was some bald guy...
A prophet...

...But not like any of that matters anyway. Still,
what's this "something" that caught Laugus's
interest?

I don't know... But the answer is on the other side
of...the big door...
...The let's go and check. We have the key now too.

Zeta and Eta retrace their steps until they are
back before the sealed door.
...We made it back.

Good thing this place is designed to return us to
where we were from the entrance. Now...I'd really
love to input the key we found, but...
What's wrong?

I'd like to draw a conclusion about this place based
on our info up to this point. I feel that if we go
over what we've learned so far, we'll understand what
happened.
So tell me...

I believe the explosion was caused by the remaining
members of the Cult after Laugus absconded.
I see...

Laugus parted ways with the Cult and made his escape
a long time ago. The Cult was in a frenzy to perfect
the Tears, so they would've wanted the leftover
scientists to finish it as quickly as possible.

But perfecting the Tears was too tall an order for
them. They'd been working on it for a thousand years,
nothing that happened should come as a surprise.

Most likely, they continued conducting research here
after taking it over and there was a huge explosion.
They then deserted it before a panic ensued in the
college town, leaving only Laugus's impassable door.
...How'd I do?
The Cult...is a pack of fools...
Can I take that to mean you approve?
Yeah...

Anyhow, without any evidence that Laugus fled, this
is all just guesswork. It's also possible that he
tried to get away and was caught...
I think he actually did...disappear...
Why's that?
Laugus is...like me... I know...how he thought...

For him...the Cult...was the same...as the Shadow
Garden is to me...

A convenient base...for conducting research safely...
A place of unlimited funding...to study whatever we
wish... There is no...sense of belonging involved...
Wow, you really hold yourself that far apart from us?

The principle that governs my behavior is...curiosity
toward the unknown... If something enticing appears
before me...I will pounce on it...
But...
But?
...I have Master Shadow.

I am fascinated by Master Shadow's wisdom.
His wisdom...is what keeps me here...

Not repaying debts...or love for the Garden...
This is how my inquisitive mind works...

That's why I'm certain...about Laugus's behavior...
The proof...is in my affirmation of it...

...I seriously can't make heads or tails of how you
big-brain scientists think. And yet...I believe
you, Eta.
Heh... Then I've made my case...

The two share a glance of mutual respect and then move
in unison toward the large, sealed door.
Now, the key was...
"I am a seeker of truth"—
—"A pursuer of boundless knowledge"...
With the key now spoken, the huge door slowly opens—

6.Text: It actually...opened...

Hey, it better have after all we went through.
Now, let's take a peek inside...
*gasp*
*gasp*
Wh-What...was that? Some kind of illusion?
I-I...felt it too... Some...overpowering presence...

It's not too late to turn back, you know?
...Just kidding.
N-No...let's keep going... We've come...this far...

Beyond the huge door is a spacious laboratory.
Zeta and Eta are rendered speechless by the sight
that leaps into their eyes.
What...is that?
A dragon? Is it...alive?

The back wall is made of glass, behind which
"something" sleeps in a culture fluid...
A black...
Dragon...

Zeta manages to stir her stunned legs back to life
and approach the glass wall.

We came here to investigate the Tears of Diablos,
but then we stumble upon this... It's like some kind
of bad dream.

Is it...a monster? No, dragons aren't just monsters,
are they... Ugh, I can't wrap my head around this...
Incredible...

Eta approaches the glass wall as if drawn to it.
She looks spellbound as she gazes at the dragon,
as if completely enthralled by it.
U-Uh, Eta? Be careful...

*sigh*... Laugus... You really had something
crazy squirreled away, didn't you...
...Huh? What have we here...
Zeta reaches out and picks up a nearby book.
This binding is just like the journal...

Zeta opens the book. As she suspected, it's a journal
of Lord Laugus's, just like the one they found in the
library a moment ago.

—I've finally found it. My theories were correct.
I've successfully created an artificial aperture to
a world in another dimension.

A world in another dimension? Artificial aperture?
What's he talking about?

Zeta reads more of the journal full of similar
unusual terminology.

—Based on the level of magic flowing through this
world, I can presume it is not a higher realm of much
magnitude. Nevertheless, this is undoubtedly the
first step toward a revolution.

—It is the possible existence of multiple such
worlds and rulers of these worlds that is truly
important.

—At last, I succeeded in capturing one of these
otherworldly kings. Though all others involved in
the process aside from myself may have perished
in doing so, that is of no concern.

—I am of a mind to leave this king as a gift for
fellow souls possessed of a keen mind...in the hope
that someone may yet be my equal one day.

—I have named these other-dimensional worlds
coursing with magic "realms," with the land where the
black dragon dwelt being the "12th Realm." As for
the king of that realm, I dub him—
—Nidhogg...
Eta? What happ—

What the?! The dragon's eyes are open! Eta, what
did you do?!
N-Nothing...

All I did...was press a few of these buttons while
inspecting things...
That's not "nothing"!
More importantly—
More importantly?!
It's moving...

The black dragon begins to stir lazily in its fluid
prison. The magic chains binding its limbs vanish,
and then...
The glass wall shatters.
It's...coming this way...

A-Anyway, we need to put some distance between it and
us! This way!
Grooooooooarrrr!!!
Th-This is bad... We need to stop it!

Zeta tries attacking the dragon, but it doesn't even
flinch.
Guess we can forget that idea!
...Eta! Look out!
Nidhogg slashes down at Eta with its sharp claws.
I-I'm fine... I can fend it off with slime...

Look at those gouges in the floor... One hit and
we're done for...
But we...don't have...any choice...
True... Here it comes!!!
Grooooooooarrrr!!!

7.Text: *pant, pant*
Ungh... My magic...is failing...
How can it be so strong after just waking up?

Despite not yet being at full strength after waking
from its slumber, the dragon has Zeta and Eta
overwhelmed.
Graaaaah!!!

Nidhogg waits for a moment when their attacks falter
and then turns away, smashing through the wall.
Crap! It's gonna tear things up outside!

It's wings are only partially formed...so it probably
can't fly...but it's close enough that people in
Laugus will...panic.

And it's still groggy enough that it shouldn't be
able to use its full power yet... Let's hurry!
Yeah...!
...Whew! It hasn't gone that far!
We must...stop it!
Grooooooooarrrr!!!
Unh!
Eta!!!
I'm...okay... It just grazed me...
...Step back and focus on covering me.
But you're at your limit too...
Don't worry about me! I'm still in better shape than—
Shuuuuuoooo!
Nidhogg suddenly begins sucking in air.
What...is that?
A breath attack?! You gotta be kidding!
Shuoooooo!
D-Damn... This may be it!

The air trembles, and the ground shakes. Zeta and Eta
brace themselves to accept oblivion, until—

The flash of an ebony blade cleaves through Nidhogg
and the night sky.
Groooargh?!
...Huh?
That flash... Could it be?!

My name is Shadow. I lurk in the darkness and hunt
down shadows. Black dragon... What is it you seek?
(Aha, a rare event encounter!)

(I thought I came out of the Sanctuary in the same
forest where I entered it, but it turns out it's a
totally different island...)

(I was starting to get sick of these events ending
by warping me somewhere...but this time it looks like
they threw in a bonus!)

(A dragon encounter on the way home! And this time
it's a picture-perfect black one!)

(And check out how stocky it is, and those huge eyes!
It's everything a guy wants in a dragon from a
fantasy world!)
Shuoooooo!
...Huh? Guess this one can't talk. Bummer.
Is that really you...Master?!
My lord?! Why are you here?!
(Wha? Zeta and Eta? Why're they here?)
I was on the way home and—

(...No, wait—I should play the part of the
shadowbroker here...)
I sensed that a black dragon would appear...

What?! You mean you knew of Nidhogg's existence,
and even what we were up to?!
Our master is...impressive as ever...
I assume it's fine if I slay it?
Yes... Please do...master!
...Got it.

Magic coalesces on Shadow's sword in such amounts
to make even a dragon incapable of speech feel fear.
Graarrrr...
Atomic—
GRAAAAAAAAAAGH!!!

The area goes silent, and Nidhogg is engulfed by the
torrent of radiance.
...What happened to Nidhogg?
It's...gone... Along with...the research facility...
He beat it like it was nothing...

...Maybe I overdid it a bit? It was a dragon, so I
figured it'd be able to survive that...
My lord!

Ah yeah, Zeta and Eta. Are you guys okay? Sorry if I
stole your kill back there.

No...we were outmatched... I'm sorry, my lord.
We didn't mean to trouble you.
I'm so ashamed of myself...

Not at all, that was actually pretty fun. I'm glad
you two are in one piece as well...
My lord...

Still...it's a shame...to lose such a valuable...
research subject... Maybe it will...appear again?
...Are you serious?
...Just joking.
Yeah right...

By the way, when did you two become such good friends
that you go off on secret adventures together? I had
no idea.
No, we aren't good friends...
...Well you sure seem in sync to me.

Zeta and Eta share a look after unintentionally
saying the exact same thing.

...Well, I suppose we are alike in how we think first
and foremost of our lord, perhaps.
...Yes. I want his brains...
That's not what I said.
Haha, you're definitely in sync. It's a good thing.

...Which reminds me. I made quite a scene back there,
so I think we're going to have company soon,
especially with this being near a tourist
destination. We need to get out of here, fast.

Right, in that case I think this is our best route.
The road turns into cliffs up ahead, and then—

All but saying this is her big chance, Zeta seizes
the initiative by taking Shadow's hand to show him
the way.
You never miss a thing...Zeta...

Just as Eta starts to follow after them, she notices
a scrap of paper at her feet.
...Hm? Is this...a piece of Laugus's journal?
—Ye of keen mind. Are ye satisfied?

—This world is too small to satiate my ravenous
mind...as ye surely know by now. However, perhaps in
another world, I might—
The journal cuts off there.
Lord...Laugus...
C'mon, Eta. We're leaving.
On...my way...

Eta burns the scrap with magic and slowly follows
after Zeta and Shadow...
Wait...
What were you doing? We almost left without you.
...Zoning out.
Moving at your own pace as always, eh...

Anyway, we need to make a report on these "realms"
and their "rulers" to the Garden when we get back...

You mean that dragon? Ah right, so that's the
setup... It's magic did feel kinda different than the
Mist Dragon's—
...Setup?

(Going off that black color scheme I'm gonna call
this new type of dragon a "realm dragon"— Yeah,
that's pretty good.)
Something on your mind?
No, it's nothing.

What I'm really thinking, though, is that I wanna get
home on the double. Think you can stay with me if I
pick up the pace? The Bushin Festival is just about
to start, so...
...I just really don't want to miss this big wave!
I-I'm fine, no worries!
I-I'll...do my best...

Zeta and Eta run along the nighttime road, doing
their best to keep up with Shadow's somewhat-serious
sprint.

The next day, every muscle in their bodies was sore,
with Eta in particular being unable to move for some
time—
